result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ariel Krion Walker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Status Conference hearing with Defendant's other cases 21CF3655 and 22CF449. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant waived preliminary hearing. Signed Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver signed and filed. Defendant in custody. Defense counsel requested Plea hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing, Branch 40. Plea hearing scheduled December 13, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN PERSON in room 634 of the Courthouse.
Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.

Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestions, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Sargent is in trial in another court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, defendant in custody.  Constantire Siapkaris Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Sargent fail to appear due to being in Intake Court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent
All previously ordered terms and conditions remain in full effect.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Ariel Krion Walker not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a bail/bond hearing upon request from the State.  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Preliminary hearing remains scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch PE.
Received and Filed: Notice of State's Objection to Bail Set in ICCR and Request for Immediate Relief.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLL (6/12/2006).

02:21 PM Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Ariel Krion Walker in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ariel Krion Walker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
